200.description: All of the installed, activated packages on Integration Server.

post.summary: Installs a package on an Integration Server instance by specifying a .zip filename or directory name that is inside the inbound package directory. The actual name of the package may change once installed if a manifest.rel is included in the zipped package, and only in a zipped package.  This occurs if a <value name="target_pkg_name"> tag is present in the manifest.rel. If the desired package was in the form of a directory, and that directory included a manifest.rel with a <value name="target_pkg_name"> then the manifest.rel will have no effect on the package name once installed.

schema.description: A general action to take on the package manager where 'install' will install a package based on the filename parameter, which is required when using the 'install' parameter.
The package in the form of a directory or zip file located in the inbound package directory required for package installation. This parameter is used in conjunction with action="install".
Activate the package upon installation. Default is true.
Archive the package upon installation. Default is true.
When CSRF Guard is enabled in Integration Server, all requests must contain this header.

keyStoreType.description: Certificate file format of the keystore file.

keyStoreProvider.description: Provider that is used for the keystore.

keyStoreLocation.description: Location of the keystore file on the server. This can be the full pathname or a relative path in relation to the Integration Server.

keyStorePassword.description: Password for the keystore file associated with this alias.

isHsm.description: Whether the keystore is stored on a Hardware Security Module (HSM) device.

alias.description: An unique name that identifies the port.

packageName.description: The package associated with the port.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the port is enabled. When the port is enabled, it is accepting requests.

bindAddress.description: IP address to which to bind this port. Use a bind address if your machine has multiple IP addresses and you want the port to use this specific address.

backlog.description: The number of requests that can remain in the queue for an enabled port before Integration Server begins rejecting requests.

minThread.description: The minimum number of threads Integration Server maintains in the thread pool for this port.

maxThread.description: The maximum number of threads Integration Server maintains in the thread pool for this port.

threadPriority.description: Priority with which the Java treats threads from this thread pool. The larger the number, the higher the priority.

idleTimeout.description: When to close the WebSocket client connection if the server has not received a request from the client within this timeout value.

clientAuth.description: The type of client authentication you want Integration Server to perform for requests that arrive on this WebSocket or WebSocketSecure port. Integration Server uses user name and password.

secure.description: Whether this port uses TLS for secure communications. This must be set to true for a WebSocketSecure port

keystoreAlias.description: Name of the keystoreAlias used by the WebSocketSecure port where the keystore contains private keys and certificates for an Integration Server, partner application, or Integration Server component.

keyAlias.description: Name of the keyAlias within a keyStoreAlias used by the WebSocketSecure port.

smtpServer.description: Address of the Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) server through which Integration Server issues email messages.

port.description: Port that Integration Server connects to on the specified SMTP server.

tlsSettings.description: Type of SSL encryption that Integration Server uses when communicating with the SMTP server port.

trustStoreAlias.description: Alias for the truststore that contains the list of certificates that Integration Server uses to validate the trust relationship between Integration Server and the SMTP server.

internalEmail.description: Email address to which Integration Server sends administrator messages, such as license key expiration, Enterprise Gateway rule violations, and messages about critical log entries.

serviceEmail.description: Email address to which Integration Server sends a message when a service failure occurs.

defaultEmailCharset.description: Character set that Integration Server uses for the emails that it sends.

username.description: The email address of the account that Integration Server uses to connect to the SMTP server.

password.description: The password for the account that Integration Server uses to connect to the SMTP server.

policyApplicability.description: Users to which account locking policy applies.

message.description: Descriptive success or failure message for performing an action on a JNDI connection alias.

name.description: Security provider name

KeyStoreTypes.description: Types of keystores used by the security provider

maxIssuerSkew.description: Maximum number of seconds by which the JWT issuer and Integration Server clocks can differ and still allow JWT expiry (exp) and not before (nbf) validations to succeed.

hostName.description: The host name or IP address of the SFTP server.

port.description: The port number of the SFTP server. The port number must be within the range of 0 and 65535 (inclusive).

hostKeyLocation.description: Public key of the SFTP server.

preferredKeyExchangeAlgorithms.description: The algorithms that Integration Server presents to the SFTP server for key exchange.

proxyAlias.description: The proxy alias through which the request to the SFTP server is to be routed.

preferredMACS2C.description: A list of preferred server-to-client Message Authentication Code (MAC) algorithms.

preferredMACC2S.description: A list of preferred client-to-server Message Authentication Code (MAC) algorithms.

preferredCiphersS2C.description: A list of preferred server-to-client ciphers.

preferredCiphersC2S.description: A list of preferred client-to-server ciphers.

minDHKeySize.description: The minimum DH key size. The default value is 1024. This field applies when the SFTP client version is v2.

maxDHKeySize.description: The maximum DH key size. The default value is 8192. This field applies when the SFTP client version is v2.

tsaURL.description: Comma-separated list of URLs for the servers in a Terracotta Server Array.

rejoin.description: Whether to automatically rejoin a cluster if disconnected.

keyStoreType.description: Certificate file format of the truststore.

keyStoreProvider.description: Provider that is used for the truststore.

keyStoreLocation.description: Location of the truststore file on the server. This can be the full pathname, or a relative path in relation to the Integration Server.

userName.description: The user name for the SFTP user account.

authenticationType.description: The type of authentication that Integration Server uses to authenticate itself to the SFTP server.

sftpServerAlias.description: The alias of the SFTP server to which you want the specified user to connect.

password.description: The password for the specified SFTP user. This field applies when authenticationType is set to password.

passPhrase.description: The passphrase for the private key for the specified SFTP user. Supply a passPhrase only if the private key specified in privateKeLocation requires a passphrase. This field applies when authenticationType is set to publicKey.

privateKeyFileLocation.description: The location of the private key of the specified SFTP user. This field applies when authenticationType is set to publicKey.

maximumRetries.description: The number of times Integration Server attempts to connect to the SFTP server. The maximum allowed value is 6. The minimum allowed value is 1. The default is 6 retries. This field applies when the specified sftpServerAlias uses the v1 version of the SFTP client.

connectionTimeout.description: The number of  seconds that Integration Server waits for a response from the SFTP server before timing out and terminating the request. The default is 0, which indicates that the session never times out.

sessionTimeout.description: The number of minutes Integration Server waits before terminating an idle session. The default is 10 minutes.

compression.description: The compression algorithm for the data.

compressionLevel.description: The compression level to use if you set the compression field to zlib. The minimum allowed value is 1. The maximum is 6. The default is 6. This field applies when the specified sftpServerAlias uses the v1 version of the SFTP client.

strictHostKeyChecking.description: Whether Integration Server verifies the host key of the SFTP server before establishing a connection to the SFTP server.

packageName.description: The package associated with the port.

alias.description: An alias for the port that is unique for this Integration Server.

enabled.description: Whether this Internal Server port is enabled.

enterpriseGatewayHost.description:
The host name or IP address of the machine on which
Enterprise Gateway Server is running.

enterpriseGatewayPort.description: The registration port on Enterprise Gateway Server.

maxConnection.description:
The number of connections maintained between Enterprise
Gateway Server and the Internal Server.

clientAuth.description: The type of authentication used by this port.

threadPool.description: Whether port has a its own pool of threads.

minimumThreads.description: if threadpool is true, the minimum number of threads in the thread pool for the port.

maximumThreads.description: if threadpool is true, the maximum number of threads in the thread pool for the port.

threadPriority.description: if threadpool is true, the priority of threads in the thread pool.

username.description:
The name of the user on Enterprise Gateway Server that
the Internal Server should connect as.

password.description:
The password of the user on Enterprise Gateway Server
that the Internal Server should connect as.

useJSSE.description: Whether the port will be created using the Java Secure Socket Extension.

keyAlias.description: Key alias for the private key associated with the keystore alias.

keyStore.description: Keystore alias, which contains private keys and certificates for an Integration Server, partner application, or Integration Server component.

trustStore.description: Truststore alias for the truststore that contains the trusted root of a certificate or signing authority (CA).

kerberosSettings.description: The Kerberos settings for the port. This field is present when clientAuth is "requestKerberos" or "requireKerberos".

message.description: Message

provider.description: Specifies the type of external directory server, if any, that this server uses for user account and group information.

cacheSize.description: Maximum number of LDAP users Integration Server can keep in memory in the user cache.

cacheExpire.description:
Number of minutes an LDAP user's credentials
(userid and password) can remain in the credential
cache before being purged

providerURL.description: The URL of the initial context for sessions with the JNDI provider.

initialContextFactory.description: The class name of the JNDI provider. The initial context is the starting point that the JNDI provider users to resolve names for naming and directory operations.

description.description: Description of the JNDI connection alias.

otherProperties.description: The additional properties for JNDI configuration required by the JNDI provider.

keystoreAlias.description: The alias for the keystore that contains the client certificates for Integration Server to use when connecting to the JNDI provider.

keystoreFormatPropertyName.description: The JNDI property name for storing the keystore format.

keystoreKeyAlias.description: The alias to the key that contains the private key for connecting to the JNDI provider.The key alias must be in the keystore specified in keystoreAlias.

keystorePasswordPropertyName.description: The JNDI property name for storing the keystore password. This field is required if a keystoreAlias value is set for the JNDI connection alias.

keystorePropertyName.description: The JNDI property name for storing the keystore location. This field is required if a keystoreAlias value is set for the JNDI connection alias.

privateKeyPropertyName.description: The JNDI property name for storing the private key name.

providerURLFailoverList.description: One or more provider URLs that Integration Server should use if the connection to the primary JNDI provider fails.

securityCredentials.description: The security credentials that the JMS administrator provides to the JNDI provider.

securityPrincipal.description: The name of the security principal that the JMS administrator provides to the JNDI provider.

trustoreAlias.description: The alias for the truststore that contains the certificates of the Certificate Authority (CA) for the JNDI provider.

truststorePasswordPropertyName.description: The JNDI property name for storing the truststore password. This field is required if the truststoreAlias value is set for the JNDI connection alias.

truststorePropertyName.description: The JNDI property name for storing the truststore location. This field is required if the truststoreAlias value is set for the JNDI connection alias.

useSSL.description: Whether to use SSL to connect to the JNDI provider.

subjectPublicKeyAlgorithm.description: Public-key algorithm used in the certificate.

displayName.description: Descriptive, display name of the property.

value.description: Property value. For the threshold property for the health indicator "Cluster", use a positive integer as the value. For all other health indicators, use an integer value from 1 to 99.

name.description: Name of the webMethods messaging connection alias.

csqCount.description: The number of messages in the client side queue (CSQ) for this alias.

type.description: The type of webMethods messaging connection alias.

clientPrefix.description: A string that identifies the Integration Server to the webMethods messaging provider (Universal Messaging or Broker).

clientPrefixShared.description: Whether Integration Server shares the client prefix with multiple Integration Servers and you want to prevent automatic updates, including deletions, to shared objects associated with this alias on the webMethods messaging provider.

brokerHost.description: Name (DNSname: port or ipaddress: port) of the machine on which the Broker Server resides. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

brokerName.description: Name of the Broker as defined on the Broker Server.  Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

clientGroup.description: Broker client group to which this Integration Server belongs. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

clientAuth.description: The type of authentication an Integration Server client will use to connect to the webMethods messaging provider.The value SSL is applicable for aliases of type BROKER only. The value CERTIFICATE_BASED is applicable for aliases of type UM only.

user.description: Username for basic authentication.

password.description: Password for basic authentication.

useCsq.description: Whether a client side queue is used with this Universal Messaging connection alias.Applicable for alias of type UM only.

csqSize.description: The maximum number of documents (messages) that can exist in the client side queue for this Universal Messaging connection alias. Leave empty for a value of UNLIMITED. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

csqDrainInOrder.description: Whether Integration Server drains the client side queue for this alias by sending the messages to the Universal Messaging server in the same order in which Integration Server placed the messages in the client side queue. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

publishWaitTime.description: Number of milliseconds that a publishing service using this Universal Messaging connection alias will wait for a connection to the Universal Messaging server to be re-established after the connection fails. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

followTheMasterProducers.description: Whether Integration Server always connects to the master realm server in a Universal Messaging cluster when Integration Server uses this Universal Messaging connection alias to send messages. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

enableRequestReply.description: Whether a request/reply channel is created for this Universal Messaging connection alias on Universal Messaging and whether a listener for replies is created on Integration Server. Applicable for alais of type UM only.

followTheMasterConsumers.description: Whether Integration Server always connects to the master realm server in a Universal Messaging cluster when Integration Server uses this Universal Messaging connection alias to retrieve messages. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

realmUrl.description: The URL for the Universal Messaging server in the format nsp:// UM_host: UM_port (for example, nsp://127.0.0.1:9000 or nsp://localhost:9000). Applicable for alias of type UM only.

maxRetryAttempts.description: Maximum number of reconnection attempts that Integration Server makes if the connection to Universal Messaging fails. The default is 5 attempts. Applicable for alais of type UM only.

loggingType.description: Where Integration Server writes log messages when enhanced logging is enabled for the message producers and/or consumers that use this messaging connection alias to send and/or receive documents. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

enableProducerMessageTracking.description: Whether Integration Server writes additional log messages when a message producer uses this connection alias to publish documents that are instances of the publishable document types listed in producerIncludedStrings. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

producerIncludedStrings.description: Name of each channel that corresponds to a publishable document type for which Integration Server performs additional logging during publication. Use a semicolon (;) to separate each channel name. A value of [ALL] indicates that Integration Server performs enhanced logging for every channel to which this connection alias sends messages. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

enableConsumerMessageTracking.description: Whether Integration Server writes additional log messages for messaging consumers (triggers) that use this messaging connection alias to receive messages. Integration Server writes additional log message for the triggers listed in consumerIncludedStrings. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

consumerIncludedStrings.description: The fully qualified name of the triggers for which Integration Server performs additional logging during trigger processing. Use a semicolon (;) to separate each trigger name. A value of [ALL] indicates that Integration Server performs enhanced logging for every trigger that uses this connection alias to receive messages. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

keystore.description: The full path to the keystore file for this Integration Server. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

keystoreType.description: The file type of the keystore file for Integration Server. The file type can be either PKCS12. Applicable for type BROKER only.

keystorePassword.description: Password required to access the SSL certificate in the keystore file for Integration Server. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

encrypted.description: Whether to encrypt the connection between the Integration Server and the Broker. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

truststore.description: The full path to the truststore file for the Integration Server client. Applicable if encrypted is true. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

truststoreType.description: The file type of the truststore file for Integration Server. The file type is JKS. Applicable if encrypted is true. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

keystoreAlias.description: The alias for the keystore that contains the client certificates that you want Integration Server to use when connecting to the Universal Messaging port. You must set a keystoreAlias if the Universal Messaging port is configured for certificate-based authentication, i.e. when value of clientAuth is CERTIFICATE_BASED. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

keyAlias.description: The alias to the key that contains the private key for connecting to the Universal Messaging port securely. The key alias must be in the keystore specified in field keystoreAlias. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

truststoreAlias.description: The alias for the truststore that contains the certificate authority (CA) certificates for the Universal Messaging server. You must set a truststoreAlias if the Universal Messaging port is configured for certificate-based authentication, i.e. when value of clientAuth is CERTIFICATE_BASED. You must also set a truststoreAlias if the protocol specified for realmUrl is nsps or nhps. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

packageName.description: Name of the package.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the package is enabled.

loadok.description: Number of elements that loaded successfully.

loaderr.description: Number of elements that generated errors and could not be loaded when the package was installed or relaoded.

loadwarning.description: Number of elements that generated warnings when the package was installed or reloaded.

patch_nums.description: A list of patches that have been applied to this release of the package, if this information was provided by the package publisher.

jvm_version.description: Minimum version of the JVM required to run this package.

time.description: Time that the package release was created.

listACL.description: Access Control List assigned to the package.

loadedWithWarnings.description: A list of services that generated warnings when the package was installed.

notLoaded.description: A list of services that generated errors and could not be loaded onto the server when the package was installed.

successors.description: Packages that depend on this package.

predecessors.description: Packages on which this package depends.

subscribers.description: List of other webMethods Integration Servers that subscribe to this package.

message.description: Status response message returned from internal service that retrieves package information.

code.description: Status response code returned from internal service that retrieves package information.

samlUrl.description: URL of the SAML resolver in My webMethods Server.

sslKeyStoreAlias.description: Alias for the keystore containing the private key and server certificate to use when presenting Integration Server's SSL credentials.

sslKeyAlias.description: Key alias for the private key to use when presenting Integration Server's SSL credentials.

signKeyStoreAlias.description: Alias for the keystore containing the private keys and certificates to use to sign outgoing messages.

signKeyAlias.description: Key alias for the private key to use to sign outgoing messagees.

decryptKeyStoreAlias.description: Alias for the keystore containing the private keys and certificates used to decrypt incoming messages.

decryptKeyAlias.description: Key alias for the private key to use when decrypting incoming messages.

trustStoreAlias.description: Alias for the truststore that contains the certificates of the signing authorities associated with the selected keystore.

jvmKeyStore.description: Alias for the keystore used for the JVM.

jvmTrustStore.description: Alias for the truststore used for the JVM.

name.description: Name of the MQTT trigger.

packageName.description: Package to which the MQTT trigger belongs.

aliasName.description: The MQTT connection alias that the MQTT trigger uses to retrieve messages.

topic.description: The topic to which the MQTT trigger is subscribed.

qos.description: Descriptive value of the quality of service of the MQTT trigger.

serviceName.description: Service that is invoked when the MQTT trigger receives a message.

decodingType.description: Type indicating how Integration Server decodes the payload of the MQTT message when placing it in the input pipeline for the trigger service.

state.description: Whether the MQTT trigger is enabled, disabled, or suspended.

acknowledgmentMode.description: How Integration Server acknowledges messages received on behalf of a MQTT trigger.

executionUser.description: Descriptor that indicates which credentials Integration Server should use when invoking services associated with the MQTT trigger.

maxExecutionThreads.description: Maximum number of messages that Integration Server can process for the trigger concurrently.

queueCapacity.description: Maximum number of messages that the MQTT trigger queue can contain.

maxRetryAttempts.description: Maximum number of times Integration Server attempts to re-execute the trigger service.

retryInterval.description: Number of milliseconds that Integration Server waits between retry attempts.

onRetryFailure.description: Action that Integration Server takes upon retry failure for an MQTT trigger, where 0 specifies "Throw service exception" and 1 specifies "Suspend and retry later".

resourceMonitoringService.description: A service that checks the availability of resources used by a trigger.

status.description: The status of the MQTT trigger, which can be Running or Not Running (reason) where reason identifies why the trigger is not running, such as Not Running (Connection Alias Not Running).

currentQueueSize.description: Current number of messages in the local trigger queue.

currentThreadCount.description: Current number of server threads processing messages for this MQTT trigger.

lastError.description: The most recent error associated with the MQTT trigger.

name.description: Name of the condition in the webMethods messaging trigger.

service.description: Name of the service that Integration Server invokes when it receives documents that satisfy the trigger condition.

joinType.description: The join type for the trigger condition. This field displays N/A if the trigger condition specifies only one publishable document type.

documentTypes.description: All the publishable document types used within this condition.

serverUpdates.description: The installed core updates on this Integration Server.

packageUpdates.description: The installed updates for all packages on this Integration Server.

allowedWritePaths.description:
List of directories and/or files to which the services in the
pub.file folder and the pub.flow:savePipelineToFile service have
write permission.

allowedReadPaths.description:
List of directories and/or files to which the services in the
pub.file folder and the pub.flow:restorePipelineFromFile service  have read permission.

allowedDeletePaths.description:
List of directories and/or files that the services in the pub.file
folder can delete.

description.description: A description of the JMS connection alias.

transactionType.description: The type of transaction for sessions that use this JMS connection alias.

clientId.description: The JMS client identifier associated with the connections established by this JMS connection alias. The clientId must be specified when createConnectionUsing is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

user.description: User name required to acquire a connection from the connection factory.

password.description: Password required to acquire a connection from the connection factory.

createConnectionUsing.description: How administered objects (connection factories and destinations) will be looked up.

jndiAliasName.description: Alias to the JNDI provider that the JMS connection alias uses to look up administered objects. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is JNDI_LOOKUP.

connectionFactoryLookupName.description: Lookup name for the connection factory that you want to use to create a connection to the JMS provider specified in this JMS connection alias. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is JNDI_LOOKUP.

createAdministeredObjectsOnDemand.description: Whether Integration Server creates a connection factory or destination on the JNDI provider if the object is not found at the time Integration Server looks up the object. This field applies only when the JMS provider is Universal Messaging.

enableFollowTheMaster.description: Whether Integration Server always connects to the master realm server in the Universal Messaging cluster. This setting affects producer and consumer connections created using this JMS connection alias.

monitorWmConnectionFactory.description: How Integration Server monitors the webMethods connection factory object on the JNDI server for changes where NONE means no monitoring is done, CLIENT_POLL corresponds to specifying an interval for poll changes (connectionFactoryPollInterval) , JNDI_POLL corresponds to polling for changes with an interval defined by webMethods Connection Factory , and LISTENER corresponds to monitoring the connection factory by registering an event listener. This field applies only when Universal Messaging is the JMS provider.

connectionFactoryPollingInterval.description: Number of minutes between polling attempts. The polling interval must be a positive integer. This field is required when monitorWmConnectionFactory is set to CLIENT_POLL. This field applies only when the JMS provider is Univesal Messaging.

brokerHost.description: Name (DNSname:port or ipaddress:port) of the machine on which the Broker Server acting as the JMS provider resides. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

brokerName.description: Name of the Broker as defined on the Broker Server. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

clientGroup.description: Name of the client group to which you want Integration Server to belong when it acts as a JMS client. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

brokerList.description: Comma-delimited list of Broker Servers on which the connection between the Integration Server (acting as the JMS client) and the webMethods Broker can exist. Use the following format: {Broker Name]@<host>[:port]. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

keystore.description: Full path to this Integration Server's keystore file. The keystore field is required only when configuring an SSL connection to the Broker. This field applies only when the  createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

keystoreType.description: File type of the Integration Server's keystore file. The keystoreType is required only when configuring an SSL connection to the Broker This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

truststore.description: The full path to this Integration Server client's trust store file. The trustore field is required only when configuring an SSL connection to the Broker. This field applies only when the  createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

trustoreType.description: The file type of the Integration Server's trust store file, which is JKS. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

encrypted.description: Whether the connection between the Integration Server and the Broker is encrypted. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

classLoader.description: Name of the class loader used with this JMS connection alias.

maximumCsqSize.description: Maximum number of messages that can exist in the client side queue for this JMS connection alias. A value of -1 indicates there is no limit.

csqDrainInOrder.description: Whether Integration Server drains the client side queue by sending the messages to the JMS provider in the same order in which Integration Server placed the messages in the client side queue.

createTemporaryQueue.description: Whether Integration Server creates a temporary queue on the JMS provider to handle request-reply operations that do not specify a replyTo destination.

enableRequestReplyListener.description: Whether or not Integration Server creates a single dedicated MessageConsumer for receiving synchronous replies sent to the temporary queue for this JMS connection alias.

manageDestinations.description: Whether users can use Designer to modify Destinations on Broker or Universal Messaging

createNewConnectionPerTrigger.description: Whether Integration Server creates a separate connection to the JMS provider for each trigger.

producerCachingMode.description: Whether caching of JMS Session and MessageProducer objects is enabled for this JMS connection alias.

minPoolSizePerUnspecifiedDestination.description: The minimum number of entries (JMS Session objects) for the default session pool.

maxPoolSizePerUnspecifiedDestination.description: The maximum number of entries (JMS Session objects) for the default session pool.

minPoolSizePerDestination.description: The minimum number of entries (Message Producers) in each destination-specific pool.

maxPoolSizePerDestination.description: The maximum number of entries in each destination-specific pool. A value of 0 (or blank) indicates that Integration Server does not create separate pools for any of the destinations.

cacheProducersQueueList.description: A semicolon-delimited list of the queues for which Integration Server creates destination pools. This field only applies when producerCachingMode is set to ENABLED_PER_DESTINATION and createConnectionUsing is set to NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

destinationLookupNames.description: A semicolon delimited list of the lookup names for the destinations for which Integration Server creates destination pools. This field applies only when producerCachingMode is set to ENABLED_PER_DESTINATION andcreateConnectionUsing value is JNDI_LOOKUP.

cacheProducersTopicList.description: A semicolon-delimited list of the topics for which Integration Server creates destination pools. This field only applies when producerCachingMode is set to ENABLED_PER_DESTINATION and createConnectionUsing is set to NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

idleTimeout.description: The number of milliseconds before an inactive pool entry will be removed from the pool. This setting applies to the default pool as well as each destination specific pool. A value of 0 indicates that pool entries never expire. A value of -1 indicates the system default will be used. The system default is defined by setting watt.server.jms.producer.pooledSession.timeout which has a default value of 60000 ms.

producerMaxRetryAttempts.description: The maximum number of times Integration Server automatically retries a pub.jms:send service that fails because of a transient error. Set to 0 to disable automatic retry for implementations of the pub.jms:send service that use this JMS connection alias.

producerRetryInterval.description: The number of milliseconds that Integration Server waits between attempts to retry a pub.jms:send service that uses this JMS connection alias.

loggingType.description: Where Integration Server writes log messages when enhanced logging is enabled for the message producers and/or consumers that use this JMS connection alias to send and/or receive messages.

enableProducerMessageTracking.description: Whether Integration Server writes additional log messages when a message producer uses this JMS connection alias to send messages to a destination in producerIncludedStrings.

producerIncludedStrings.description: The destination names for which Integration Server performs additional logging when sending messages to the destination. Use a semicolon (;) to separate each destination name. A value of [ALL] indicates that Integration Server performs enhanced logging for every destination to which this JMS connection alias sends messages.

enableConsumerMessageTracking.description: Whether Integration Server writes additional log messages for messaging consumers (triggers) that use this JMS connection alias to receive messages. Integration Server writes additional log message for the triggers listed in consumerMessageIncludedStrings

consumerIncludedStrings.description: The fully qualified name of the triggers for which Integration Server performs additional logging during trigger processing. Use a semicolon (;) to separate each trigger name. A value of [ALL] indicates that Integration Server performs enhanced logging for every trigger that uses this JMS connection alias to receive messages.

backlog.description: When the port receives requests faster than can be processed, indicates the maximum number of requests that can be queued.

keepAliveTimeout.description: The length of time, in milliseconds, that idle client connections will be kept open on the port.

threadPool.description: Indicates whether the port has its own pool of threads.

minThread.description: If threadPool is true, the minimum number of threads in the thread pool for the port.

maxThread.description: If threadPool is true, the maximum number of threads in the thread pool for the port.

threadPriority.description: If threadPool is true, the priority of the threads in the thread pool.

threadsInUse.description: If threadPool is true, the number of threads from the pool that are currently in use.

alias.description: A unique name that identifies the port

packageName.description: The package the port is associated with

enabled.description: Indicates whether the port is enabled, that is, currently accepting requests.

bindAddress.description: If the computer has more than one network interface, this field identifies which interface the port uses. The value can be an IPv4 or IPv6 address.

clientAuth.description: The type of authentication used by this port

useJSSE.description: Whether the port will be created using the Java Secure Socket Extension.

keyAlias.description: Specifies a text identifier for the keystore, which contains private keys and certificates for an Integration Server, partner application, or Integration Server component

keyStore.description: Specifies a text identifier for the private key associated with the keystore alias

trustStore.description: Specifies a text identifier for the truststore, which contains the trusted root of a certificate or signing authority (CA).

allowedWritePaths.description:
List of directories and/or files to which the services in the
pub.file folder and the pub.flow:savePipelineToFile service have
write permission.

allowedReadPaths.description:
List of directories and/or files to which the services in the
pub.file folder and the pub.flow:restorePipelineFromFile service  have read permission.

allowedDeletePaths.description:
List of directories and/or files that the services in the pub.file
folder can delete.

name.description: Name of the link

availableMemory.description: Amount of unused memory in KB that is currently available to the Java virtual machine.

availableMemoryPercentage.description: Percentage of unused memory that is currently available to the Java virtual machine.

totalMemory.description: Amount of memory in KB that is guaranteed to be available to the Java virtual machine.

message.description: Message
Descriptive success or failure message for performing an action on a webMethods messaging connection alias.

rootContextID.description: Context information that provides a consistent, interpretable audit trail of activity that the webMethods Monitor can use to relate entries within the log.

parentContextID.description: Context information that provides a consistent, interpretable audit trail of activity that the webMethods Monitor can use to relate entries within the log.

contextID.description: Context information that provides a consistent, interpretable audit trail of activity that the webMethods Monitor can use to relate entries within the log.

auditTimestamp.description: Date and time the auditing request entered the audit subsystem.

insertTimestamp.description: Date and time the audit record was written to the database or file system.

clientID.description: IP address of the host from which the request originated.

userID.description: User name for the client that generated the audit event.

type.description: Category for the security event that occurred (authentication, authorization, certificates, configuration, etc.).

message.description: Text of the logged message or information about the security action.

result.description: The result of the request for which security action was logged, either SUCCESS or FAILURE.

serviceName.description: Name of the service that generated the audit event.

resubmittable.description: Whether or not webMethods Monitor can resubmit the service.

serverID.description: IP address or host name of the server on which Integration Server is running.

sessionState.description: Statue of the session. Possible values are STARTED, EXPIRED, and ENDED.

sessionName.description: Client who initiated the action that caused the session to be created. This can be the IP address of the client, system, or internal connection.

rpcs.description: Number of services the client has called so far this session.

age.description: How long the session existed (in milliseconds) before it expired or ended.

sessionID.description: A string Integration Server generates to identify each session uniquely.

txMsg.description: Name of the guaranteed delivery process that is running.

txStatus.description: Status of guaranteed delivery transaction. The status can be: STARTED, ENDED or FAILED.

txErrMsg.description: If the transaction failed, the error message that describes the error that occurred.

uuid.description: Universally unique identifier for the message being sent or received.

alias.description: Name of the messaging connection alias associated with the sent or received message.

destination.description: Destination to which the message was sent.

messageId.description: The ID assigned to the message by the messaging provider.

trigger.description: Name of the trigger that received the message.

mode.description: Indicates whether Integration Server wrote the log message on behalf of a message producer or consumer for webMethods messaging or JMS messaging.

errorMessage.description: Optional error message, describing the type of error.

duration.description: How long the service ran (in milliseconds) before the error occurred.

errStackTrace.description: Trace that shows the call sequence leading to the error.

serviceStack.description: Parent services for the service in which the error occurred.

audience.description: Audience value to use for this Integration Server. Specify a valid string or URI.

maxGlobalSkew.description: Maximum number of seconds by which the JWT issuer and Integration Server clocks can differ and still allow JWT expiry (exp) and not before (nbf) validations to succeed.

csqCount.description: The number of messages in the client side queue (CSQ) for this alias.

type.description: The type of webMethods messaging connection alias.

clientPrefix.description: A string that identifies the Integration Server to the webMethods messaging provider (Universal Messaging or Broker).

clientPrefixShared.description: Whether Integration Server shares the client prefix with multiple Integration Servers and you want to prevent automatic updates, including deletions, to shared objects associated with this alias on Universal Messaging server or Broker.

brokerHost.description: Name (DNSname: port or ipaddress: port) of the machine on which the Broker Server resides. Applicable for type BROKER only.

brokerName.description: Name of the Broker as defined on the Broker Server. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

clientGroup.description: Broker client group to which this Integration Server belongs. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

clientAuth.description: The type of authentication an Integration Server client will use to connect to the Broker.The value SSL is only applicable for an alias of type BROKER. The value CERTIFICATE_BASED is only applicable for aliases of type UM.

user.description: Username for basic authentication.

password.description: Password for basic authentication.

useCsq.description: Whether a client side queue is used with this Universal Messaging connection alias.Applicable for alias of type UM only.

csqSize.description: The maximum number of documents (messages) that can exist in the client side queue for this Universal Messaging connection alias. Leave empty for a value of UNLIMITED. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

csqDrainInOrder.description: Whether Integration Server drains the client side queue for this alias by sending the messages to the Universal Messaging server in the same order in which Integration Server placed the messages in the client side queue. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

publishWaitTime.description: Number of milliseconds that a publishing service using this Universal Messaging connection alias will wait for a connection to the Universal Messaging server to be re-established after the connection fails. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

followTheMasterProducers.description: Whether Integration Server always connects to the master realm server in a Universal Messaging cluster when Integration Server uses this Universal Messaging connection alias to send messages. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

enableRequestReply.description: Whether a request/reply channel is created for this Universal Messaging connection alias on Universal Messaging and whether a listener for replies is created on Integration Server. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

followTheMasterConsumers.description: Whether Integration Server always connects to the master realm server in a Universal Messaging cluster when Integration Server uses this Universal Messaging connection alias to retrieve messages. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

realmUrl.description: The URL for the Universal Messaging server in the format nsp:// UM_host: UM_port (for example, nsp://127.0.0.1:9000 or nsp://localhost:9000). Applicable for alias of type UM only.

maxRetryAttempts.description: The maximum number of reconnection attempts that Integration Server makes if the connection to Universal Messaging fails. The default is 5 attempts. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

loggingType.description: Where Integration Server writes log messages when enhanced logging is enabled for the message producers and/or consumers that use this messaging connection alias to send and/or receive documents. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

enableProducerMessageTracking.description: Whether Integration Server writes additional log messages when a message producer uses this connection alias to publish documents that are instances of the publishable document types listed in producerIncludedStrings. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

producerIncludedStrings.description: Name of each channel that corresponds to a publishable document type for which Integration Server performs additional logging during publication. Use a semicolon (;) to separate each channel name. A value of [ALL] indicates that Integration Server performs enhanced logging for every channel to which this connection alias sends messages. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

enableConsumerMessageTracking.description: When set to true indicates that Integration Server writes additional log messages for messaging consumers (triggers) that use this messaging connection alias to receive messages. Integration Server writes additional log message for the triggers listed in consumerIncludedStrings. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

consumerIncludedStrings.description: The fully qualified name of the triggers for which Integration Server performs additional logging during trigger processing. Use a semicolon (;) to separate each trigger name. A value of [ALL] indicates that Integration Server performs enhanced logging for every trigger that uses this connection alias to receive messages. Applicable for type UM only.

keystore.description: The full path to the keystore file for this Integration Server. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

keystoreType.description: The file type of the keystore file for Integration Server. The file type can be either PKCS12. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

keystorePassword.description: Password required to access the SSL certificate in the keystore file for Integration Server. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

encrypted.description: Whether to encrypt the connection between the Integration Server and the Broker. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

truststore.description: The full path to the truststore file for the Integration Server client. A truststore file contains trusted root certificates for the  authorities responsible for signing SSL certificates. For an SSL connection to be made, a valid trusted root for the SSL certificate  stored in the keystore must be accessible in a truststore file. Applicable if isEncrypted is true. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

truststoreType.description: The file type of the truststore file for Integration Server. The file type is JKS. Applicable if isEncrypted is true. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

keystoreAlias.description: The alias for the keystore that contains the client certificates that you want Integration Server to use when connecting to the Universal Messaging port. You must set a keystoreAlias if the Universal Messaging port is configured for certificate-based authentication, i.e. when value of clientAuth is CERTIFICATE_BASED. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

keyAlias.description: The alias to the key that contains the private key for connecting to the Universal Messaging port securely. The key alias must be in the keystore specified in field keystoreAlias. Applicable for type UM only.

truststoreAlias.description: The alias for the truststore that contains the certificate authority (CA) certificates for the Universal Messaging server. You must set a truststoreAlias if the Universal Messaging port is configured for certificate-based authentication, i.e. when value of clientAuth is CERTIFICATE_BASED. You must also set a truststoreAlias if the protocol specified for realmUrl is nsps or nhps. Applicable for type UM only.

status.description: The status of the JMS trigger, which can be: Running or Not Running (reason), where reason identifies why the trigger is not running, such as Not Running (trigger disabled).

aliasName.description: JMS connection alias that the JMS trigger uses to retreive messages.

type.description: Type of JMS trigger, which can be: standard SOAP (SOAP-JMS).

acknowledgmentMode.description: How Integration Server acknowledges messages received on behalf of a JMS trigger.

executionUser.description: The user whose credentials Integration Server uses when invoking services associated with the JMS trigger.

joinExpires.description: Whether the join expires after the time period specified in field expireAfter.

expiresAfter.description: How long Integration Server waits for the remaining documents in the join. The default join time-out is 1 day. (displayed in milliseconds)

reuse.description: Whether this element can be dragged from the CentraSite Registry Explorer view to a BPM process or CAF project When this property is set to public, you can drag the asset to a BPM process or CAF project.

processingMode.description: Whether the JMS trigger uses a serial or concurrent processing mode.

maxExecutionThreads.description: Maximum number of messages that Integration Server can process for the trigger at concurrently.

connectionCount.description: Nnumber of connections this trigger makes to the JMS provider.

maxBatchMessages.description: Maximum number of messages that the trigger service can receive at one time.

maxRetryAttempts.description: Maximum number of times Integration Server attempts to re-execute the trigger service.

retryInterval.description: Number of milliseconds that Integration Server waits between retry attempts.

onRetryFailure.description: Action that Integration Server uses upon retry failure for an JMS trigger, where 0 specifies "Throw service exception" and 1 specifies "Suspend and retry later".

resourceMonitoringService.description: Service that programmatically checks the availability of resources used by a trigger.

exactlyOnceDetectDuplicates.description: Whether exactly-once processing is enabled for the JMS trigger. When enabled, Integration Server checks a message's redelivery count to determine whether the trigger has received the message before.

exactlyOnceUseHistory.description: Whether a document history database is maintained and used to determine whether a message is a duplicate.

exactlyOnceUseHistoryTimeToLive.description: Length of time the document history database maintains an entry for a message processed by the JMS trigger.

documentResolverService.description: Service that determines if the message status is New, Duplicate, or In Doubt.

maxPrefetchSize.description: Maximum number of messages that are retrieved and cache per request for this trigger. Using pre-fetch cache can speed up the retrieval of messages from webMethods Broker or Universal Messaging.

joinType.description: The type of join for a JMS trigger that receives messages from multiple destinations.

destinations.description: The list of destinations from which the trigger will receive messages.

routingRules.description: The list of routing rules that the trigger uses.

tlsSettings.description: The type of SSL encryption that Integration Server uses when communicating with an email server. You can configure the port to use None , Explicit, or Implicit.

trustStore.description: Alias for the truststore that contains certificates presented by the email server to Integration Server.

logout.description: For use with IMAP and multi-threading only. Whether you want your server to log out after checking for mail.

runAsUser.description: The user name under which requested services are to run.

authenticateWithMessage.description: When set to true, Integration Server checks for $user and $pass parameters in the Subject line of the email. The user name is the user under which the service is to run on Integration Server. When set to false, specify the user in the runAsUser field.

useJSSE.description: Whether the port will be created using the Java Secure Socket Extension.

globalService.description: The service that you want Integration Server to execute for every email request.

defaultService.description: The service that you want Integration Server to execute if the email message does not supply a valid service in the subject line and the globalService field is blank.

reply.description: Whether you want Integration Server to send any output that the service generates to the original sender in an email attachment.

replyOnError.description: Whether you want Integration Server to report errors to the original sender in the body portion of an email.

remove.description: Whether you want Integration Server to delete a valid email from the IMAP server once Integration Server has successfully received the email.

deleteInvalid.description: Whether you want Integration Server to delete invalid emails from the IMAP server.

multiThreaded.description: Whether you want Integration Server to use multiple threads for this port.

numThreads.description: The number of threads you want Integration Server to use for this port. This field is applicable only if multiThreaded is true.

invokePerPart.description: Whether Integration Server invokes the service for each part of a multipart message or just once for the entire message.

includeHeaders.description: Whether Integration Server includes the email headers when passing an email message to the content handler.

urlEncodedBody.description: Whether the email body contains URL-encoded input parameters to be decoded into IData, placed in the pipeline, and passed to the service.

message.description: Descriptive success or failure message of performing an action on an MQTT trigger.

alias.description: The port alias.

portID.description: A unique ID for the port created by Integration Server by combining enterpriseGatewayHost and enterpriseGatewayPort.

licenseKeyFile.description: The path to where the license key file is stored.

terracottaLicenseFile.description: The path to where the Terracotta license file is stored

name.description: Name of the JMS alias.

enabled.description: Whether the JMS connection alias is enabled.

connected.description: Whether the JMS connection alias is connected.

hasTriggers.description: Indicates if any JMS triggers use this JMS connection alias.

csqCount.description: Current number of messages in the client side queue (CSQ) for this JMS connection alias.

description.description: A description of the JMS connection alias.

transactionType.description: Type of transaction for sessions that use this JMS connection alias.

clientID.description: Client identifier associated with the connections established by this JMS connection alias.

user.description: User name required to acquire a connection from the connection factory.

password.description: Password required to acquire a connection from the connection factory.

createConnectionUsing.description: How administered objects (connection factories and destinations) will be looked up.

jndiAliasName.description: Alias to the JNDI provider that the JMS connection alias uses to look up administered objects. This field applies only when createConnectionUsing is JNDI_LOOKUP.

connectionFactoryLookupName.description: Lookup name for the connection factory that you want to use to create a connection to the JMS provider specified in this JMS connection alias. This field applies only when createConnectionUsing is JNDI_LOOKUP.

createAdministeredObjectsOnDemand.description: Whether Integration Server creates a connection factory or destination on the JNDI provider if the object is not found at the time Integration Server looks up the object. This field applies only when the JMS provider is Universal Messaging.

enableFollowTheMaster.description: Whether Integration Server always connects to the master realm server in the Universal Messaging cluster. This setting affects producer and consumer connections created using this JMS connection alias.

monitorWmConnectionFactory.description: How Integration Server monitors the webMethods connection factory object on the JNDI server for changes where NONE means no monitoring is done, CLIENT_POLL corresponds to specifying an interval for poll changes (connectionFactoryPollInterval) , JNDI_POLL corresponds to polling for changes with an interval defined by webMethods Connection Factory , and LISTENER corresponds to monitoring the connection factory by registering an event listener. This field applies only when createConnectionUsing value is JNDI_LOOKUP and Broker is the JMS provider.

connectionFactoryPollingInterval.description: Number of minutes between polling attempts. The polling interval must be a positive integer. This field is required when monitorWmConnectionFactory is set to CLIENT_POLL. This field applies only when createConnectionUsing value is JNDI_LOOKUP and Broker is the JMS provider.

brokerHost.description: Name (DNSname:port or ipaddress:port) of the machine on which the Broker Server acting as the JMS provider resides. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

brokerName.description: Name of the Broker as defined on the Broker Server. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

clientGroup.description: Name of the client group to which you want Integration Server to belong when it acts as a JMS client. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

brokerList.description: Comma-delimited list of Broker Servers on which the connection between the Integration Server (acting as the JMS client) and the webMethods Broker can exist. Use the following format: {Broker Name]@<host>[:port]. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

keystore.description: Full path to this Integration Server's keystore file. The keystore field is required only when configuring an SSL connection to the Broker. This field applies only when the  createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

keystoreType.description: File type of the Integration Server's keystore file. The keystoreType is required only when configuring an SSL connection to the Broker This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

truststore.description: The full path to this Integration Server client's trust store file. The trustore field is required only when configuring an SSL connection to the Broker. This field applies only when the  createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

trustoreType.description: The file type of the Integration Server's trust store file, which is JKS. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

encrypted.description: Whether the connection between the Integration Server and the Broker is encrypted. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

classLoader.description: Name of the class loader used with this JMS connection alias.

maximumCsqSize.description: Maximum number of messages that can exist in the client side queue for this JMS connection alias. A value of -1 indicates there is no limit.

csqDrainInOrder.description: Whether Integration Server drains the client side queue by sending the messages to the JMS provider in the same order in which Integration Server placed the messages in the client side queue.

createTemporaryQueue.description: Whether Integration Server creates a temporary queue on the JMS provider to handle request-reply operations that do not specify a replyTo destination.

enableRequestReplyListener.description: Whether Integration Server creates a single dedicated MessageConsumer for receiving synchronous replies sent to the temporary queue for this JMS connection alias.

manageDestinations.description: Whether users can use Designer to modify Destinations on Broker or Universal Messaging

createNewConnectionPerTrigger.description: Whether Integration Server creates a separate connection to the JMS provider for each trigger.

producerCachingMode.description: Whether caching of JMS Session and MessageProducer objects is enabled for this JMS connection alias.

minPoolSizePerUnspecifiedDestination.description: The minimum number of entries (JMS Session objects) for the default session pool.

maxPoolSizePerUnspecifiedDestination.description: The maximum number of entries (JMS Session objects) for the default session pool.

minPoolSizePerDestination.description: The minimum number of entries (Message Producers) in each destination-specific pool.

maxPoolSizePerDestination.description: The maximum number of entries in each destination-specific pool. A value of 0 (or blank) indicates that Integration Server does not create separate pools for any of the destinations.

cacheProducersQueueList.description: A semicolon-delimited list of the queues for which Integration Server creates destination pools. This field only applies when producerCachingMode is set to ENABLED_PER_DESTINATION and createConnectionUsing is set to NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

destinationLookupNames.description: A semicolon delimited list of the lookup names for the destinations for which Integration Server creates destination pools. This field applies only when producerCachingMode is set to ENABLED_PER_DESTINATION and createConnectionUsing value is JNDI_LOOKUP.

cacheProducersTopicList.description: A semicolon-delimited list of the topics for which Integration Server creates destination pools. This field only applies when producerCachingMode is set to ENABLED_PER_DESTINATION and createConnectionUsing is set to NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

idleTimeout.description:
The number of milliseconds before an inactive pool entry will be removed from the pool. This setting applies to the default pool as well as each destination specific pool.
A value of 0 indicates that pool entries never expire. A value of -1 indicates the system default will be used. The system default is defined by setting watt.server.jms.producer.pooledSession.timeout which has a default value of 60000 ms.

producerMaxRetryAttempts.description: The maximum number of times Integration Server automatically retries a pub.jms:send service that fails because of a transient error. Set to 0 to disable automatic retry for implementations of the pub.jms:send service that use this JMS connection alias.

producerRetryInterval.description: The number of milliseconds that Integration Server waits between attempts to retry a pub.jms:send service that uses this JMS connection alias.

loggingType.description: Where Integration Server writes log messages when enhanced logging is enabled for the message producers and/or consumers that use this JMS connection alias to send and/or receive messages.

enableProducerMessageTracking.description: Whether Integration Server writes additional log messages when a message producer uses this JMS connection alias to send messages to a destination in producerIncludedStrings.

producerIncludedStrings.description: The destination names for which Integration Server performs additional logging when sending messages to the destination. Use a semicolon (;) to separate each destination name. A value of [ALL] indicates that Integration Server performs enhanced logging for every destination to which this JMS connection alias sends messages.

enableConsumerMessageTracking.description: Whether Integration Server writes additional log messages for messaging consumers (triggers) that use this JMS connection alias to receive messages. Integration Server writes additional log message for the triggers listed in consumerMessageIncludedStrings

consumerIncludedStrings.description: The fully qualified name of the triggers for which Integration Server performs additional logging during trigger processing. Use a semicolon (;) to separate each trigger name. A value of [ALL] indicates that Integration Server performs enhanced logging for every trigger that uses this JMS connection alias to receive messages.

packageName.description: Package with which this port is associated.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the port is enabled. When the port is enabled, it is accepting requests.

bindAddress.description: IP address to which to bind this port. Use a bind address if your machine has multiple IP addresses and you want the port to use this specific address.

backlog.description: The number of requests that can remain in the queue for an enabled port before Integration Server begins rejecting requests.

minThread.description: The minimum number of threads Integration Server maintains in the thread pool for this port.

maxThread.description: The maximum number of threads Integration Server maintains in the thread pool for this port.

threadPriority.description: Priority with which the Java treats threads from this thread pool. The larger the number, the higher the priority.

idleTimeout.description: When to close the WebSocket client connection if the server has not received a request from the client within this timeout value.

clientAuth.description: The type of client authentication you want Integration Server to perform for requests that arrive on this WebSocket or WebSocketSecure port. Integration Server uses user name and password.

secure.description: Whether this port uses TLS for secure communications. This must be set to true for a WebSocketSecure port

keystoreAlias.description: Name of the keystoreAlias used by the WebSocketSecure port where the keystore contains private keys and certificates for an Integration Server, partner application, or Integration Server component.

keyAlias.description: Name of the keyAlias within a keyStoreAlias used by the WebSocketSecure port.

packageName.description: Package to which this port is assigned.

keyAlias.description: Name of the keyAlias within a keyStoreAlias used by the WebSocketSecure port.

url.description: The complete URL of the LDAP server. The URL has the format protocol ://hostname :portnumber

principal.description: The user ID  Integration Server supplies to connect to the LDAP server

credential.description: The password that Integration Server suppliees to connect to the LDAP server, that is, the Principal's password.

timeout.description:
Maximum number of seconds the Integration Server will wait while trying to connect to the LDAP server. After this time has passed, the Integration Server will try the
next configured LDAP server on the list.

poolMin.description:
Minimum number of connections allowed in
the pool that the Integration Server maintains for
connecting to the LDAP server.

poolMax.description:
Maximum number of connections allowed in
the pool that the Integration Server maintains for
connecting to the LDAP server.

useAffix.description:
Whether to build a distinguished name by adding a prefix and suffix to the user name. Specify true to build a distinguished name by adding a prefix and suffix to the user name. Specify false to build a query that searches a specified root directory
for the user.

dnPrefix.description: String that specifies the beginning of a DN to pass to the LDAP server.

dnSuffix.description: String that specifies the end of a DN to pass to the LDAP server.

userID.description: Identifies an LDAP userid, such as cn or uid.

userRootDN.description: Enter the full distinguished name. The Integration Server will issue a query that starts searching for users in the entered directory.

userEmail.description: Name of the attribute which contains the email address of the user in LDAP server.

group.description: Integration Server group with which the user is associated.

memberAttribute.description: Name of the attribute in a group's directory entry that identifies each member of the group.

groupRootDN.description: The full distinguished name of the location at which Integration Server is to start searching. Integration Server will issue a query that starts searching for group in the entered directory.

priority.description: Priority of this LDAP directory configuration in relation to other LDAP directory configurations.

truststoreAlias.description: Truststore alias associated with the issuer.

certificateAlias.description: Certificate alias for the certificate associated with the truststore alias.

message.description: Descriptive success or failure message after performing an action on a JMS trigger.

alias.description: An unique name that identifies the port.

packageName.description: The package associated with the port.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the port is enabled. When the port is enabled, it is accepting requests.

bindAddress.description: IP address to which to bind this port. Use a bind address if your machine has multiple IP addresses and you want the port to use this specific address.

threadPriority.description: Priority with which the Java treats threads from this thread pool. The larger the number, the higher the priority.

secure.description: Whether the global variable value is to be handled in a secure manner. If true, Integration Server encrypts the value and saves it as an outbound password.

timeToIdleSeconds.description: Seconds an unmodified and unaccessed element can remain in the cache. The default value of 0 indicates that the elements in this cache do not have a time-to-idle expiration.

timeToLiveSeconds.description: Seconds an element can remain in the cache. The default value of 0 indicates that the elements in this cache do not have a time-to-live expiration.

maxElementsInMemory.description: Maximum number of elements the cache will hold in memory.

maxEntriesLocalDisk.description: Maximum number of elements the cache will hold in the local file system.

overflowToDisk.description: Whether cache uses the local file system when maxElementsInMemory is exceeded.

overflowToOffHeap.description: Whether cache uses off-heap memory when maxElementsInMemory is exceeded.

maxMemoryOffHeap.description: Maximum off-heap memory the cache will use.

memoryStoreEvictionPolicy.description: Policy to determine which elements are evicted from cache.

diskExpiryThreadIntervalSeconds.description: The interval between runs of the cache's expiry thread.

diskPersistent.description: Whether to persist the cache to disk between JVM restarts.

diskSpoolBufferSizeMB.description: The amount of memory in megabytes to allocate for the write buffer to the disk.

eternal.description: Whether the elements in the cache never expire.

diskAccessStripes.description: The number of disk access stripes

cacheLoaderTimeoutMillis.description: Timeout in milliseconds for cache loader related calls.

maxEntriesInCache.description: Maximum number of entries to be held in the cache.

isInternal.description: Whether cache is used internally by Integration Server. Care should be taken before modifying the configuration of an internal cache

cacheManagerAlive.description: Whether cache's cache manager is alive.

audience.description: Audience value to use for this Integration Server. Specify a valid string or URI.

maxGlobalSkew.description: Maximum number of seconds by which the JWT issuer and Integration Server clocks can differ and still allow JWT expiry (exp) and not before (nbf) validations to succeed.

global.description: Indicates that the IP access for a port is inherited from the global IP access settings. This field is present only when true.

accessMode.description: The IP access mode is used to determine which hosts are permitted on the port. When you explicitly assign IP access settings to a port, those settings override the global settings for Integration Server. If you do not assign IP access settings to a port or delete the IP access settings for a port, the port uses the global settings. "allowByDefault" accepts all hosts except those in the denyList. "denyByDefault" rejects all hosts except those in the allowList.

allowList.description: An allow list to specify hosts that are permitted to access this port when accessMode is "denyByDefault". The values in this list may be host names or IP addresses. Entries may be wildcarded such as "*.some-company.com" and "123.45.6.*".

denyList.description: A deny list to specify hosts that are prohibited from accessing this port when accessMode is "allowByDefault". The values in this list may be host names or IP addresses. Host names may be wildcarded such as "*.some-company.com" and "123.45.6.*".

alias.description: A unique name that identifies the port.

diagnostic.description: Indicates whether this port is the diagnostic port for Integration Server. Field is present only when true.

packageName.description: The package associated with the port.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the port is enabled. When the port is enabled, it is accepting requests.

bindAddress.description: If the computer has more than one network interface, this field identifies which interface the port uses. The value can be an IPv4 or IPv6 address.

clientAuth.description: The type of authentication used by this port.

backlog.description: When the port receives requests faster than can be processed, indicates the maximum number of requests that can be queued.

keepAliveTimeout.description: The length of time, in milliseconds, that idle client connections will be kept open on the port.

threadPool.description: Indicates whether the port has its own pool of threads.

minThread.description: If threadPool is true, the minimum number of threads in the thread pool for the port.

maxThread.description: If threadPool is true, the maximum number of threads in the thread pool for the port.

threadPriority.description: If threadPool is true, the priority of the threads in the thread pool.

threadsInUse.description: If threadPool is true, the number of threads from the pool that are currently in use.

delay.description: The number of milliseconds to delay before processing each request received on the port.

suspended.description: Indicates whether the port is suspended. If false, the port is accepting requests.

message.description: Information about the operation that just completed.

keyAlias.description: Key alias for the private key associated with the keystore alias.

keyStore.description: Keystore alias, which contains private keys and certificates for an Integration Server, partner application, or Integration Server component.

trustStore.description: Truststore alias for the truststore, which contains the trusted root of a certificate or signing authority (CA).

useJSSE.description: Whether the port will be created using the Java Secure Socket Extension.

description.description: A description of the JMS connection alias.

transactionType.description: The type of transaction for sessions that use this JMS connection alias.

clientId.description: The JMS client identifier associated with the connections established by this JMS connection alias. The clientId must be specified when createConnectionUsing is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

user.description: User name required to acquire a connection from the connection factory.

password.description: Password required to acquire a connection from the connection factory.

connectionFactoryLookupName.description: Lookup name for the connection factory that you want to use to create a connection to the JMS provider specified in this JMS connection alias. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is JNDI_LOOKUP.

createAdministeredObjectsOnDemand.description: Whether Integration Server creates a connection factory or destination on the JNDI provider if the object is not found at the time Integration Server looks up the object. This field applies only when the JMS provider is Universal Messaging.

enableFollowTheMaster.description: Whether Integration Server always connects to the master realm server in the Universal Messaging cluster. This setting affects producer and consumer connections created using this JMS connection alias.

This field applies only when Universal Messaging is the JMS provider.

connectionFactoryPollingInterval.description: Number of minutes between polling attempts. The polling interval must be a positive integer. This field is required when monitorWmConnectionFactory is set to CLIENT_POLL. This field applies only when the JMS provider is Univesal Messaging.

brokerName.description: Name of the Broker as defined on the Broker Server. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

Use the following format: {Broker Name]@<host>[:port]. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

next configured LDAP server on the list.

Minimum number of connections allowed in
the pool that Integration Server maintains for

Maximum number of connections allowed in
the pool that Integration Server maintains for
connecting to the LDAP server.
