When set to true, Integration Server builds a distinguished name by adding a prefix and suffix to the user name. When set to false, Integration Server builds a query that searches a specified root directory
for the user.

queueCapacity.description: Current maximum capacity for the trigger queue. If the current queue capacity is different from the configured queue capacity (that is, the Queue Capacity Throttle is set to less than 100%), the configured queue capacity is displayed in parenthesis.

ackQueueSize.description: Maximum number of pending document acknowledgements for this trigger.

maxRetryAttempts.description: Maximum number of times Integration Servercan re-execute the trigger service if the trigger service fails because of an ISRuntimeException

retryInterval.description: Number of milliseconds that Integration Server waits between attempts to re-execute the trigger service

onRetryFailure.description: How Integration Server handles retry failure for this trigger.

resourceMonitoringService.description: The service that Integration Server executes to determine the availability of resources associated with the trigger service.

processingMode.description: Whether Integration Server processes the documents in the trigger queue concurrently or serially.

maxExecutionThreads.description: Maximum number of server threads that can process documents for this trigger concurrently.

suspendOnError.description: Whether Integration Server suspends document processing and document retrieval automatically when a trigger service ends with an exception

exactlyOnceDetectDuplicates.description: Whether Integration Server uses duplicate detection to ensure exactly-once processing for documents received by this trigger

exactlyOnceUseHistory.description: Whether a document history will be maintained and used to determine whether a document is a duplicate.

exactOnceHistoryTimeToLive.description: Length of time the document history database maintains an entry for a document processed by the trigger

priorityEnabled.description: Whether priority messaging for the trigger is enabled or disabled.

triggerClientId.description: The client ID for the webMethods messaging trigger.

defaultClientId.description: The client ID for the default client on Integration Server.

retrievalState.description: Whether document retrieval is active or suspended for this trigger.

processingState.description: Whether document processing is active or suspended for this trigger.

currentThreadsProccesing.description: The current number of server threads processing documents for this trigger.

volatileQueue.description: The current number of documents in the volatile queue for the trigger.

persistedQueue.description: The current number of documents in the persisted queue for the trigger.

policyApplicability.description: Users to which account locking policy applies.

cacheManagerName.description: Name of the cache manager in which to create the cache.

timeToIdleSeconds.description: Seconds an unmodified and unaccessed element can remain in the cache. The default value of 0 indicates that the elements in this cache do not have a time-to-idle expiration.

timeToLiveSeconds.description: Seconds an element can remain in the cache. The default value of 0 indicates that the elements in this cache do not have a time-to-live expiration.

maxElementsInMemory.description: Maximum number of elements the cache can hold in on-heap memory.

maxEntriesLocalDisk.description: Maximum number of elements the cache can hold in the local file system.

overflowToDisk.description: Whether cache uses local file system when maxElementsInMemory is exceeded.

overflowToOffHeap.description: Whether cache uses off-heap memory when maxElementsInMemory is exceeded.

maxMemoryOffHeap.description: Maximum off-heap memory the cache can use.

memoryStoreEvictionPolicy.description: Policy to determine which elements are evicted from cache, LRU (Least Recently Used) or LFU (Least Frequently Used).

diskExpiryThreadIntervalSeconds.description: The interval, measured in seconds, between runs of the cache's expiry thread. The default is 120.

diskPersistent.description: Whether to persist the cache to disk between JVM restarts.

diskSpoolBufferSizeMB.description: The amount of memory in megabytes to allocate for the write buffer to the disk. The default is 30 MB.

eternal.description: Whether the elements in the cache never expire. The default is false.

diskAccessStripes.description: The number of disk access stripes.

cacheLoaderTimeoutMillis.description: Timeout in milliseconds for cache loader related calls.

maxEntriesInCache.description: Maximum number of entries to be held in the cache.

isInternal.description: Whether cache is used internally by Integration Server. Care should be taken before modifying the configuration of an internal cache.

cacheManagerAlive.description: Whether cache's cache manager is alive.

service.description: Fully qualified name of the service that Integration Server executes.

runAsUser.description: User whose credentials are used to run the service.

target.description: Integration Server on which the task will run. Set to $any for any server connected to the database, $all for all servers in a cluster of Integration Servers, or the specific server name.

inputs.description: Input to the service that Integration Server will execute.

lateness.description: The maximum number of minutes Integration Server waits before taking the specified latenessAction, if the task is overdue. This applies to simple repeating and complex repeating tasks.

latenessAction.description: The action Integration Server performs if the task is overdue. Set to 0 for run immediately, 1 for run at next scheduled interval, 2 for suspend. This applies to simple repeating and complex repeating tasks.

interval.description: Execution interval in seconds. This applies to simple repeating tasks.

doNotOverlap.description: Whether Integration Server waits for the previous execution of the service to complete before starting the next. This applies to simple repeating and complex repeating tasks.

startDate.description: Date of the first execution in the format YYYY/MM/DD. The startDate is required for a one-time task.

startTime.description: Time of the first execution in the format HH:MM:SS. The startTime is required for a one-time task.

endDate.description: Date of the last execution in the format YYYY/MM/D. This field applies to repeating tasks only.

endTime.description: Time of the last execution in the format HH:MM:SS. This field applies to repeating tasks only.

delay.description: Delay in seconds, if startDate is not specified for a repeating or complex task. If startDate is not provided, then Integration Server calculates the start date as system time plus delay value.

minuteList.description: List of specific minutes when a complex repeating task will run.

hourList.description: List of specific hours when a complex repeating task will run.

dayOfMonthList.description: List of specific dates (1 - 31) when a complex repeating task will run.

monthList.description: List of specific months when a complex repeating task will run.

dayOfWeekList.description: List of specific days of the week when a complex task will run.

alias.description: Alias for the SFTP user.

userName.description: The user name for the SFTP user account.

authenticationType.description: The type of authentication that Integration Server uses to authenticate itself to the SFTP server.

sftpServerAlias.description: The alias of the SFTP server to which you want the specified user to connect.

password.description: The password for the specified SFTP user. This field applies when authenticationType is set to password.

passPhrase.description: The passphrase for the private key for the specified SFTP user. This field applies when authenticationType is set to publicKey and if the private key specified in privateKeLocation requires a passphrase.

privateKeyFileLocation.description: The location of the private key of the specified SFTP user. This field applies when authenticationType is set to publicKey.

maximumRetries.description: The number of times Integration Server attempts to connect to the SFTP server. This field applies when the specified sftpServerAlias uses the v1 version of the SFTP client.

connectionTimeout.description: The number of seconds that Integration Server waits for a response from the SFTP server before timing out and terminating the request.

sessionTimeout.description: The number of minutes Integration Server waits before terminating an idle session.

compression.description: The compression algorithm used to reduce the amount of data that is transmitted.

compressionLevel.description: The compression level to use if the compression field is set to zlib. This field applies when the specified sftpServerAlias uses the v1 version of the SFTP client.

strictHostkeyChecking.description: Whether Integration Server verifies the host key of the SFTP server before establishing a connection to the SFTP server.

useAffix.description:
Whether to build a distinguished name by adding a prefix and suffix. Specify true to build a distinguished name by adding a prefix and suffix to the user name. Specify false to build a query that searches a specified root directory

host.description: Name of the machine on which the IMAP or POP3 mail server is running.

user.description: User name that Integration Server must use to log on to the mail server.

interval.description: Frequency, in seconds, with which Integration Server checks the mail server for incoming email messages.

type.description: The type of mail server from which the email port will receive requests. Specify IMAP or POP3.

serverPort.description: The port on which the mail server listens for requests.

authentication.description: The type of authentication that Integration Server should use to connect to the specified e-mail server. Select Basic Authentication or OAuth

password.description: The password the user name used to log on to the mail server.This field applies only to Basic Authentication.

authURL.description: The URL of the endpoint that Integration Server must use to request authorization code.This field applies only to OAuth.

clientID.description: The unique public identifier that the OAuth server generates for Integration Server during registration.This field applies only to OAuth.

clientSecret.description: The unique string that the OAuth server provides to Integration Server during registration.This field applies only to OAuth.

scope.description: The e-mail server access permissions configured for Integration Server during registration. You can specify multiple scopes separated by a space.This field applies only to OAuth.

accessTokenURL.description: The URL of the endpoint that Integration Server must use to request an access token from the OAuth server.This field applies only to OAuth.

redirectURL.description: The URL that the OAuth server must use to send authentication responses to Integration Server.This field applies only to OAuth.

tlsSettings.description: The type of SSL encryption that Integration Server uses when communicating with an email server. You can configure the port to use None , Explicit, or Implicit.

trustStore.description: Alias for the truststore that contains certificates presented by the email server to Integration Server.

logout.description: For use with IMAP and multi-threading only. Whether you want your server to log out after checking for mail.

runAsUser.description: The user name under which requested services are to run.

authenticateWithMessage.description: When set to true, Integration Server checks for $user and $pass parameters in the Subject line of the email. The user name is the user under which the service is to run on Integration Server. When set to false, specify the user in the runAsUser field.

useJSSE.description: Whether the port will be created using the Java Secure Socket Extension.

globalService.description: The service that you want Integration Server to execute for every email request.

defaultService.description: The service that you want Integration Server to execute if the email message does not supply a valid service in the subject line and the globalService field is blank.

reply.description: Whether you want Integration Server to send any output that the service generates to the original sender in an email attachment.

replyOnError.description: Whether you want Integration Server to report errors to the original sender in the body portion of an email.

remove.description: Whether you want Integration Server to delete a valid email from the IMAP server once Integration Server has successfully received the email.

deleteInvalid.description: Whether you want Integration Server to delete invalid emails from the IMAP server.

multiThreaded.description: Whether you want Integration Server to use multiple threads for this port.

numThreads.description: The number of threads you want Integration Server to use for this port. This field is applicable only if multiThreaded is true.

invokePerPart.description: Whether Integration Server invokes the service for each part of a multipart message or just once for the entire message.

includeHeaders.description: Whether Integration Server includes the email headers when passing an email message to the content handler.

urlEncodedBody.description: Whether the email body contains URL-encoded input parameters to be decoded into IData, placed in the pipeline, and passed to the service.

enabled.description: Whether the audit logger is enabled.

database.description: Whether the audit logger writes to a database instead of a file.

asynchronous.description: Whether the audit logger is asynchronous.

guaranteed.description: Whether the audit logger keeps the internal queue on disk.

maxQueueSize.description: Maximum number of log entries for the internal queue.

maxRetries.description: Maximum times the audit logger should retry writing the entry to the destination if the first attempt fails because of a transient error.

retryWait.description: Number of seconds the audit logger waits between tries to connect to the database.

level.description: The log level for the audit logger. This applies to the messaging audit logger.

connectionAlias.description: Universal Messaging connection alias the audit logger uses to the audit logging queue on Universal Messaging.

queueType.description: Whether the audit logging queue for the audit logger is an internal, light-weight queue or a Universal Messaging queue.

readerThreads.description: Number of threads that Integration Server uses to retrieve log entries from the Universal Messaging queue and then write the log entries to the audit logger destination.

securityCategories.description: Security actions for which to log security-related events.

startup.description: Whether the security audit logger writes security events that occur during Integration Server startup.

logLevel.description: The logging level for the messaging audit logger.

terracottaLicenseFile.description: The path to where the Terracotta license file is stored

csqSize.description: The maximum number of documents (messages) that can exist in the client side queue for this Universal Messaging connection alias.  Leave empty for a value of UNLIMITED. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

csqDrainInOrder.description: Whether Integration Server drains the client side queue for this alias by sending the messages to the Universal Messaging server in the same order in which Integration Server placed the messages in the client side queue. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

publishWaitTime.description: Number of milliseconds that a publishing service using this Universal Messaging connection alias will wait for a connection to the Universal Messaging server to be re-established after the connection fails. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

followTheMasterProducers.description: Whether Integration Server always connects to the master realm server in a Universal Messaging cluster when Integration Server uses this Universal Messaging connection alias to send messages. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

enableRequestReply.description: Whether a request/reply channel is created for this Universal Messaging connection alias on Universal Messaging and whether a listener for replies is created on Integration Server. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

followTheMasterConsumers.description: Whether Integration Server always connects to the master realm server in a Universal Messaging cluster when Integration Server uses this Universal Messaging connection alias to retrieve messages. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

realmUrl.description: The URL for the Universal Messaging server in the format nsp:// UM_host: UM_port (for example, nsp://127.0.0.1:9000 or nsp://localhost:9000). Applicable for type UM only.

maxRetryAttempts.description: Maximum number of reconnection attempts that Integration Server makes if the connection to Universal Messaging fails. The default is 5 attempts. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

loggingType.description: Where Integration Server writes log messages when enhanced logging is enabled for the message producers and/or consumers that use this messaging connection alias to send and/or receive documents. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

enableProducerMessageTracking.description: When set to true, indicates that Integration Server writes additional log messages when a message producer uses this connection alias to publish documents that are instances of the publishable document types listed in producerIncludedStrings. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

producerIncludedStrings.description: Name of each channel that corresponds to a publishable document type for which Integration Server performs additional logging during publication. Use a semicolon (;) to separate each destination name. A value of [ALL] indicates that Integration Server performs enhanced logging for every channel to which this connection alias sends messages. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

enableConsumerMessageTracking.description: Whether Integration Server writes additional log messages for messaging consumers (triggers) that use this messaging connection alias to receive messages. Integration Server writes additional log message for the triggers listed in consumerIncludedStrings. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

consumerIncludedStrings.description: The fully qualified name of the triggers for which Integration Server performs additional logging during trigger processing. Use a semicolon (;) to separate each trigger name. A value of [ALL] indicates that Integration Server performs enhanced logging for every trigger that uses this connection alias to receive messages. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

keystore.description: The full path to the keystore file for this Integration Server. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

keystoreType.description: The file type of the keystore file for Integration Server. The file type can be either PKCS12. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

keystorePassword.description: Password required to access the SSL certificate in the keystore file for Integration Server. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

encrypted.description: Specifies whether or not to encrypt the connection between the Integration Server and the Broker. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

truststore.description: The full path to the truststore file for the Integration Server client. Applicable if encrypted is true. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

truststoreType.description: The file type of the truststore file for Integration Server. The file type is JKS. Applicable if encrypted is true. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

keystoreAlias.description: The alias for the keystore that contains the client certificates that you want Integration Server to use when connecting to the Universal Messaging port. You must set a keystoreAlias if the Universal Messaging port is configured for certificate-based authentication, i.e. when value of clientAuth is CERTIFICATE_BASED. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

keyAlias.description: The alias to the key that contains the private key for connecting to the Universal Messaging port securely. The key alias must be in the keystore specified in field keystoreAlias. Applicable alias of for type UM only.

truststoreAlias.description: The alias for the truststore that contains the certificate authority (CA) certificates for the Universal Messaging server. You must set a truststoreAlias if the Universal Messaging port is configured for certificate-based authentication, i.e. when value of clientAuth is CERTIFICATE_BASED. You must also set a truststoreAlias if the protocol specified for Realm URL is nsps or nhps. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

customerID.description: Customer ID associated with the license.

licenseTypeDetails.description: License type, either external or internal.

autoCallHome.description: Whether auto call home is activated.

packageName.description: If the response is for the list of ports in a package, this field identifies the package. If the response is for all ports in Integration Server, this field will not be present.

loginCount.description: Number of incorrect login attempts allowed during the specified timeDuration before Integration Server locks the account.

name.description: Name of the JMS connection alias.

description.description: A description of the JMS connection alias.

transactionType.description: The type of transaction for sessions that use this JMS connection alias.

clientId.description: The JMS client identifier associated with the connections established by this JMS connection alias. The clientId must be specified when createConnectionUsing is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

user.description: User name required to acquire a connection from the connection factory.

password.description: Password required to acquire a connection from the connection factory.

createConnectionUsing.description: How administered objects (connection factories and destinations) will be looked up.

jndiAliasName.description: Alias to the JNDI provider that the JMS connection alias uses to look up administered objects. This field applies only when the JMS connection alias createConnectionUsing value is JNDI_LOOKUP.

connectionFactoryLookupName.description: Lookup name for the connection factory that you want to use to create a connection to the JMS provider specified in this JMS connection alias. This field applies only when the JMS connection alias createConnectionUsing value is JNDI_LOOKUP.

createAdministeredObjectsOnDemand.description: Whether Integration Server creates a connection factory or destination on the JNDI provider if the object is not found at the time Integration Server looks up the object. This field applies only when the JMS provider is Universal Messaging.

enableFollowTheMaster.description: Whether Integration Server always connects to the master realm server in the Universal Messaging cluster. This setting affects producer and consumer connections created using this JMS connection alias.

monitorWmConnectionFactory.description: How Integration Server monitors the webMethods connection factory object on the JNDI server for changes where: NONE means no monitoring is done, CLIENT_POLL corresponds to specifying an interval for poll changes (connectionFactoryPollInterval) , JNDI_POLL corresponds to polling for changes with an interval defined by webMethods Connection Factory , and LISTENER corresponds to monitoring the connection factory by registering an event listener. This field applies only when the JMS connection alias createConnectionUsing value is JNDI_LOOKUP and Broker is the JMS provider.

connectionFactoryPollingInterval.description: Number of minutes between polling attempts. The polling interval must be a positive integer. This field is required when monitorWmConnectionFactory is set to CLIENT_POLL. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is JNDI_LOOKUP and the Broker is the JMS provider.

brokerHost.description: Name (DNSname:port or ipaddress:port) of the machine on which the Broker Server acting as the JMS provider resides. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

brokerName.description: Name of the Broker as defined on the Broker Server. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

clientGroup.description: Name of the client group to which you want Integration Server to belong when it acts as a JMS client. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

brokerList.description: Comma-delimited list of Broker Servers on which the connection between the Integration Server (acting as the JMS client) and the webMethods Broker can exist. Use the following format: {Broker Name]@<host>[:port]. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

keystore.description: Full path to this Integration Server's keystore file. The keystore field is required only when configuring an SSL connection to the Broker. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

keystoreType.description: File type of the Integration Server's keystore file. The keystoreType is required only when configuring an SSL connection to the Broker This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

truststore.description: The full path to this Integration Server client's trust store file. The trustore field is required only when configuring an SSL connection to the Broker. This field applies only when the  createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

trustoreType.description: The file type of the Integration Server's trust store file, which is JKS. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

encrypted.description: Whether the connection between the Integration Server and the Broker is encrypted. This field applies only when the createConnectionUsing value is NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

classLoader.description: Name of the class loader used with this JMS connection alias.

maximumCsqSize.description: Maximum number of messages that can exist in the client side queue for this JMS connection alias. A value of -1 indicates there is no limit.

csqDrainInOrder.description: Whether Integration Server drains the client side queue by sending the messages to the JMS provider in the same order in which Integration Server placed the messages in the client side queue.

createTemporaryQueue.description: Whether Integration Server creates a temporary queue on the JMS provider to handle request-reply operations that do not specify a replyTo destination.

enableRequestReplyListener.description: Whether or not Integration Server creates a single dedicated MessageConsumer for receiving synchronous replies sent to the temporary queue for this JMS connection alias.

manageDestinations.description: Whether users can use Designer to modify Destinations on Broker or Universal Messaging

createNewConnectionPerTrigger.description: Whether Integration Server creates a separate connection to the JMS provider for each trigger.

producerCachingMode.description: Whether caching of JMS Session and MessageProducer objects is enabled for this JMS connection alias.

minPoolSizePerUnspecifiedDestination.description: The minimum number of entries (JMS Session objects) for the default session pool.

maxPoolSizePerUnspecifiedDestination.description: The maximum number of entries (JMS Session objects) for the default session pool.

minPoolSizePerDestination.description: The minimum number of entries (Message Producers) in each destination-specific pool.

maxPoolSizePerDestination.description: The maximum number of entries in each destination-specific pool. A value of 0 (or blank) indicates that Integration Server does not create separate pools for any of the destinations.

cacheProducersQueueList.description: A semicolon-delimited list of the queues for which Integration Server creates destination pools. This field only applies when producerCachingMode is set to ENABLED_PER_DESTINATION and createConnectionUsing is set to NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

destinationLookupNames.description: A semicolon delimited list of the lookup names for the destinations for which Integration Server creates destination pools. This field applies only when producerCachingMode is set to ENABLED_PER_DESTINATION and createConnectionUsing value is JNDI_LOOKUP.

cacheProducersTopicList.description: A semicolon-delimited list of the topics for which Integration Server creates destination pools. This field only applies when producerCachingMode is set to ENABLED_PER_DESTINATION and createConnectionUsing is set to NATIVE_WEBMETHODS_API.

idleTimeout.description:
The number of milliseconds before an inactive pool entry will be removed from the pool. This setting applies to the default pool as well as each destination specific pool.
A value of 0 indicates that pool entries never expire. A value of -1 indicates the system default will be used. The system default is defined by setting watt.server.jms.producer.pooledSession.timeout which has a default value of 60000 ms.

producerMaxRetryAttempts.description: The maximum number of times Integration Server automatically retries a pub.jms:send service that fails because of a transient error. Set to 0 to disable automatic retry for implementations of the pub.jms:send service that use this JMS connection alias.

producerRetryInterval.description: The number of milliseconds that Integration Server waits between attempts to retry a pub.jms:send service that uses this JMS connection alias.

loggingType.description: Where Integration Server writes log messages when enhanced logging is enabled for the message producers and/or consumers that use this JMS connection alias to send and/or receive messages.

enableProducerMessageTracking.description: Whether Integration Server writes additional log messages when a message producer uses this JMS connection alias to send messages to a destination in producerIncludedStrings.

producerIncludedStrings.description: The destination names for which Integration Server performs additional logging when sending messages to the destination. Use a semicolon (;) to separate each destination name. A value of [ALL] indicates that Integration Server performs enhanced logging for every destination to which this JMS connection alias sends messages.

enableConsumerMessageTracking.description: Whether Integration Server writes additional log messages for messaging consumers (triggers) that use this JMS connection alias to receive messages. Integration Server writes additional log message for the triggers listed in consumerMessageIncludedStrings.

consumerIncludedStrings.description: The fully qualified name of the triggers for which Integration Server performs additional logging during trigger processing. Use a semicolon (;) to separate each trigger name. A value of [ALL] indicates that Integration Server performs enhanced logging for every trigger that uses this JMS connection alias to receive messages.

alias.description: Name of the alias.

host.description: Host Name or IP address of the remote server.

port.description: Port number to which requests will be sent on the remote server.

user.description: User name for submitting requests.

password.description: Password for user account.

ssl.description: Whether to use SSL to connect to the remote server.

keystoreAlias.description: Keystore alias for the keystore containing the private keys and certificates used for authentication with the remote server.

keyAlias.description: Key alias for a private key and associated certificate chain.

acl.description: Execute ACL that determines which user groups can use the remote server alias.

keepAlive.description: Maximum number of client keep alive connections that can be retained for reuse with the remote server.

timeout.description: Keep alive timeout (minutes) for an idle connection to the remote server.

retryServer.description: Host name or IP address of a remote server to connect to if the local Integration Server cannot connect to primary remote server.

message.description: Message regarding the scheduler action.

alias.description: Alias for the SFTP Server alias.

hostName.description: The host name or IP address of the SFTP server.

port.description: The port number of the SFTP server. The port number must be within the range of 0 and 65535 (inclusive).

hostKeyLocation.description: Public key of the SFTP server.

preferredKeyExchangeAlgorithms.description: The algorithms that Integration Server presents to the SFTP server for key exchange.

proxyAlias.description: The proxy alias through which the request to the SFTP server is to be routed.

preferredMACS2C.description: A list of preferred server-to-client Message Authentication Code (MAC) algorithms.

preferredMACC2S.description: A list of preferred client-to-server Message Authentication Code (MAC) algorithms.

preferredCiphersS2C.description: A list of preferred server-to-client ciphers.

preferredCiphersC2S.description: A list of preferred client-to-server ciphers.

minDHKeySize.description: The minimum DH key size. The default value is 1024. This field applies when the SFTP client version is v2.

maxDHKeySize.description: The maximum DH key size. The default value is 8192. This field applies when the SFTP client version is v2.

jaasContext.description: The custom JAAS context used for Kerberos authentication.

clientPrincipal.description: The principal to use for Kerberos authentication.

clientPassword.description: The password for the principal used for Kerberos authentication.

servicePrincipalForm.description: Displays username, which indicates that the principal name of the service is represented as a named user defined in the LDAP or central user directory used for authentication.

servicePrincipal.description: Specifies the service that the Kerberos client wants to access.

message.description: Descriptive success or failure message after performing an action on an MQTT connection alias.

id.description: Facility code ID used in server log, such as ISS, ISP, or ISC.

filePath.description: File path to the client certificate to import.

user.description: User name to map to the client certificate.

oldUsage.description: Previous usage for the client certificate.

usage.description: Current usage for the client certificate.

message.description: Descriptive message of the action performed.

synchronousWrites.description: Whether writes to the cache are performed synchronously.

message.description: Message regarding the cache manager action.

fileList.description: List of files within the specified package to be included in the archive.

filter.description: Type of filter to be used on the archive.

includepattern.description: String field that is used to archive only those files matching a particular pattern-matching string. You may use the * character to represent any sequence of characters (e.g., *.java would archive only the Java source files in the package).

excludepattern.description: String field that is used to archive all files except those matching a particular pattern-matching string. You may use the * character to represent any sequence of characters (e.g., *.java would archive everything except Java source files).

files_to_delete.description: String field used to identify files you want to delete from the target package.Separate each entry with a semicolon (;). When the server creates the archive file, it deletes the files you specified from the target package.

type.description: Specifies whether the archive is a complete or partial copy of the package.

name.description: Name of the archive. The archive name is also the name of the zip file that the server generates and stores in the Integration Server_directory \instances\instance_name\replicate\outbound directory. Type a name that identifies this archive uniquely. Do not type an extension. The server appends the extension .zip to the name when it creates the archive file.

description.description: Brief comment describing the archive. You can use this field for any sort of descriptive information--for example, "Week 001215 Backup" or "Preview version for training group." The description will appear on the Package Description Screen when this archive is reinstalled.

version.description: Version of the package that you are archiving. You must specify a version number in the form n.n.n (e.g., 2.0, 2.3, 2.3.1). Because the server assumes that version numbers increase over time, make sure every new version of a package has a version number that is greater than the previous one.

build.description: Number that you can use to distinguish different generations of the package within the same version. Must be a numeric value that increases over time.

patch_nums.description: Describes which patches this archive includes. A patch can be identified with any name or number that is meaningful to your site and/or the users of the package. Typically, a patch is identified using a code (e.g., TMgr-031501 or FIX-10002) or a number (e.g., 100049) that represents a particular fix or set of fixes.

target_server_version.description: Version of the webMethods Integration Server that must be used with this release. (ex: 10.0)

jvm_version.description: Specifies the minimum version of the Java Virtual Machine that must be used with this release. (ex: 1.8)

target_pkg_version.description: If this archive contains a patch (partial package), the version number of the package that it modifies. The server will allow the patch to be applied only to the version you specify.

operatingSystem.description: Operating systems on which Integration Server is licensed to run .

productCode.description: Software AG code for the product: PIE.

usage.description: The environment on which the licensed server will be used. For example Production.

renewalDate.description: Renewal date which is the expirationDate minus 28 days.

higherLevPosNr.description: Higher level Pos. Nr., if license key is for bundled component.

higherLevProdCode.description: Higher level product code, if license key is for bundled component.

higherLevProdName.description: Name of bundle, if license key is for bundled component.

userName.description: The user name for the SFTP user account.

authenticationType.description: The type of authentication that Integration Server uses to authenticate itself to the SFTP server.

sftpServerAlias.description: The alias of the SFTP server to which you want the specified user to connect.

password.description: The password for the specified SFTP user. This field applies when authenticationType is set to password.

passPhrase.description: The passphrase for the private key for the specified SFTP user. Supply a passPhrase only if the private key specified in privateKeLocation requires a passphrase. This field applies when authenticationType is set to publicKey.

privateKeyFileLocation.description: The location of the private key of the specified SFTP user. This field applies when authenticationType is set to publicKey.

maximumRetries.description: The number of times Integration Server attempts to connect to the SFTP server. The maximum allowed value is 6. The minimum allowed value is 1. The default is 6 retries. This field applies when the specified sftpServerAlias uses the v1 version of the SFTP client.

connectionTimeout.description: The number of  seconds that Integration Server waits for a response from the SFTP server before timing out and terminating the request. The default is 0, which indicates that the session never times out.

sessionTimeout.description: The number of minutes Integration Server waits before terminating an idle session. The default is 10 minutes.

compression.description: The compression algorithm for the data.

compressionLevel.description: The compression level to use if you set the compression field to zlib. The minimum allowed value is 1. The maximum is 6. The default is 6. This field applies when the specified sftpServerAlias uses the v1 version of the SFTP client.

strictHostKeyChecking.description: Whether Integration Server verifies the host key of the SFTP server before establishing a connection to the SFTP server.

kerberosRealm.description: The domain name of the Kerberos server, in all uppercase letters.

kerberosKDC.description: The host name of the machine on which the KDC resides.

kerberosConfig.description: The location of the Kerberos configuration file that contains the Kerberos configuration information.

useSubjectCreds.description: Whether to use a Kerberos V5 Generic Security Services (GSS) mechanism to obtain the necessary credentials from an existing subject set up by the JAAS authentication module.

settingNames.description: List of extended settings to reset to default values.

properties.description: An array of the properties to update for the indicator.

password.description: Password

openIDprovider.description: OpenID provider that authenticates an OpenID Provider user.

allowDigestAuth.description: Whether to allow password digest as an authentication option.

groups.description: Groups to which the user belongs.

maxIssuerSkew.description: Maximum number of seconds by which the JWT issuer and Integration Server clocks can differ and still allow JWT expiry (exp) and not before (nbf) validations to succeed.

priceUnit.description: The number of core processors per CPU that this Integration Server is licensed to run on.

priceQuantity.description: The number of CPUs that this Integration Server is licensed to run on.

typeOfInstallation.description: Environment used for the installation. For example, Production.

licenseType.description: Whether the license type is Standard or Limited.

extendedRights.description: Shows what the extnded right are. For example, Virtual Machine

metering.description: Indicates if license is metered, and if yes, what kind of metering.

newAlias.description: New alias name for the proxy server.

host.description: Host Name or IP address of the proxy server.

port.description: Port number of the proxy server.

username.description: User name Integration Server must use to access the proxy server.

password.description: Password Integration Server must use to access the proxy server.

isDefault.description: Whether the proxy server is the default proxy server for a particular protocol.

protocol.description: Protocol to be used for the proxy server. Supported protocols are: HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, or SOCKS.

ftpType.description: If FTP is used, specifies the type of command Integration Server must use to issue an outbound request to the FTP proxy server. Valid values are 0-7 where the values are mapped as follows: 0:No proxy, 1:ftp_user@ftp_host no proxy auth, 2:ftp_user@ftp_host proxy auth, 3:site command, 4:open command, 5:ftp_user@proxy_user@ftp_host, 6:proxy_user@ftp_host, 7:ftp_user@ftp_host proxy_user

socksVersion.description: If SOCKS is used, specifies the version of SOCKS protocol Integration Server will use to connect to the proxy server. Valid values are 4 and 5 where the values are mapped as follows:  4:SOCKS v4, 5:SOCKS v5

enabled.description: Whether the audit logger is enabled.

database.description: Whether the audit logger writes to a database instead of a file.

asynchronous.description: Whether the audit logger is asynchronous.

guaranteed.description: Whether the audit logger keeps the internal queue on disk.

maxQueueSize.description: Maximum number of log entries for the internal queue.

maxRetries.description: Maximum times the audit logger should retry writing the entry to the destination if the first attempt fails because of a transient error.

retryWait.description: Number of seconds the audit logger waits between tries to connect to the database.

level.description: The log level for the audit logger. This applies to the messaging audit logger.

connectionAlias.description: Universal Messaging connection alias the audit logger uses to the audit logging queue on Universal Messaging.

queueType.description: Whether the audit logging queue for the audit logger is an internal, light-weight queue or a Universal Messaging queue.

readerThreads.description: Number of threads that Integration Server uses to retrieve log entries from the Universal Messaging queue and then write the log entries to the audit logger destination.

securityCategories.description: Security actions for which to log security-related events.

startup.description: Whether the security audit logger writes security events that occur during Integration Server startup.

logLevel.description: The logging level for the messaging audit logger.

name.description: Name of the webMethods messaging connection alias..

connected.description: Whether the webMethods messaging connection alias is connected.

enabled.description: Whether the webMethods messaging connection alias is enabled.

csqCount.description: The number of messages in the client side queue (CSQ) for this alias.

type.description: The type of webMethods messaging connection alias.

hasTriggers.description: Whether the webMethods messaging connection alias has triggers associated with it.

isUpdated.description: Whether the alias is updated. This is only applicable to an alias of type BROKER.

lastError.description: The most recent error related to the webMethods messaging connection alias.

isDefault.description: Whether this webMethods messaging  connection alias is the default alias.

clientPrefix.description: A string that identifies the Integration Server to the webMethods messaging provider (Universal Messaging or Broker).

clientPrefixShared.description: Whether Integration Server shares the client prefix with multiple Integration Servers and you want to prevent automatic updates, including deletions, to shared objects associated with this alias on Universal Messaging server or Broker.

brokerHost.description: Name (DNSname: port or ipaddress: port) of the machine on which the Broker Server resides. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

brokerName.description: Name of the Broker as defined on the Broker Server. The default name is Broker #1. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

clientGroup.description: Broker client group to which this Integration Server belongs. Applicable for type BROKER only.

clientAuth.description: The type of authentication an Integration Server client will use to connect to the Broker.The value SSL is only applicable for an alias of type BROKER. The value CERTIFICATE_BASED is only applicable for aliases of type UM.

user.description: Username for basic authentication.

password.description: Password for basic authentication.

useCsq.description: Whether a client side queue is used with this Universal Messaging connection alias.Applicable for alias of type UM only.

csqSize.description: The maximum number of documents (messages) that can exist in the client side queue for this Universal Messaging connection alias.  Leave empty for a value of UNLIMITED. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

csqDrainInOrder.description: Whether Integration Server drains the client side queue for this alias by sending the messages to the Universal Messaging server in the same order in which Integration Server placed the messages in the client side queue. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

publishWaitTime.description: Number of milliseconds that a publishing service using this Universal Messaging connection alias will wait for a connection to the Universal Messaging server to be re-established after the connection fails. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

followTheMasterProducers.description: Whether Integration Server always connects to the master realm server in a Universal Messaging cluster when Integration Server uses this Universal Messaging connection alias to send messages. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

enableRequestReply.description: Whether a request/reply channel is created for this Universal Messaging connection alias on Universal Messaging and whether a listener for replies is created on Integration Server. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

followTheMasterConsumers.description: Whether Integration Server always connects to the master realm server in a Universal Messaging cluster when Integration Server uses this Universal Messaging connection alias to retrieve messages. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

realmUrl.description: The URL for the Universal Messaging server in the format nsp:// UM_host: UM_port (for example, nsp://127.0.0.1:9000 or nsp://localhost:9000). Applicable for type UM only.

maxRetryAttempts.description: Maximum number of reconnection attempts that Integration Server makes if the connection to Universal Messaging fails. The default is 5 attempts. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

loggingType.description: Where Integration Server writes log messages when enhanced logging is enabled for the message producers and/or consumers that use this messaging connection alias to send and/or receive documents. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

enableProducerMessageTracking.description: When set to true, indicates that Integration Server writes additional log messages when a message producer uses this connection alias to publish documents that are instances of the publishable document types listed in producerIncludedStrings. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

producerIncludedStrings.description: Name of each channel that corresponds to a publishable document type for which Integration Server performs additional logging during publication. Use a semicolon (;) to separate each destination name. A value of [ALL] indicates that Integration Server performs enhanced logging for every channel to which this connection alias sends messages. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

enableConsumerMessageTracking.description: Whether Integration Server writes additional log messages for messaging consumers (triggers) that use this messaging connection alias to receive messages. Integration Server writes additional log message for the triggers listed in consumerIncludedStrings. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

consumerIncludedStrings.description: The fully qualified name of the triggers for which Integration Server performs additional logging during trigger processing. Use a semicolon (;) to separate each trigger name. A value of [ALL] indicates that Integration Server performs enhanced logging for every trigger that uses this connection alias to receive messages. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

keystore.description: The full path to the keystore file for this Integration Server. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

keystoreType.description: The file type of the keystore file for Integration Server. The file type can be either PKCS12. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

keystorePassword.description: Password required to access the SSL certificate in the keystore file for Integration Server. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

encrypted.description: Specifies whether or not to encrypt the connection between the Integration Server and the Broker. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

truststore.description: The full path to the truststore file for the Integration Server client. Applicable if encrypted is true. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

truststoreType.description: The file type of the truststore file for Integration Server. The file type is JKS. Applicable if encrypted is true. Applicable for alias of type BROKER only.

keystoreAlias.description: The alias for the keystore that contains the client certificates that you want Integration Server to use when connecting to the Universal Messaging port. You must set a keystoreAlias if the Universal Messaging port is configured for certificate-based authentication, i.e. when value of clientAuth is CERTIFICATE_BASED. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

keyAlias.description: The alias to the key that contains the private key for connecting to the Universal Messaging port securely. The key alias must be in the keystore specified in field keystoreAlias. Applicable alias of for type UM only.

truststoreAlias.description: The alias for the truststore that contains the certificate authority (CA) certificates for the Universal Messaging server. You must set a truststoreAlias if the Universal Messaging port is configured for certificate-based authentication, i.e. when value of clientAuth is CERTIFICATE_BASED. You must also set a truststoreAlias if the protocol specified for Realm URL is nsps or nhps. Applicable for alias of type UM only.

accessMode.description: The IP access mode is used to determine which hosts are permitted on the port. When you explicitly assign IP access settings to a port, those settings override the global settings for Integration Server. If you do not assign IP access settings to a port or delete a IP access settings for a port, the port uses the global settings. "allowByDefault" accepts all hosts except those in the denyList. "denyByDefault" rejects all hosts except those in the allowList.

allowList.description: An allow list to specify hosts that are permitted to access this port when accessMode is "denyByDefault". The values in this list may be host names or IP addresses. Values may be wildcarded such as "*.some-company.com" and "123.45.6.*".

denyList.description: A deny list to specify hosts that are prohibited from accessing this port when accessMode is "allowByDefault". The values in this list may be host names or IP addresses. Values may be wildcarded such as "*.some-company.com" and "123.45.6.*".

interval.description: Frequency, in seconds, with which Integration Server checks the mail server for incoming email messages.

type.description: The type of mail server from which the email port will receive requests. Specify IMAP or POP3.

serverPort.description: The port on which the mail server listens for requests.

authentication.description: The type of authentication that Integration Server should use to connect to the specified e-mail server. Select Basic Authentication or OAuth

password.description: The password the user name used to log on to the mail server.This field applies only to Basic Authentication.

authURL.description: The URL of the endpoint that Integration Server must use to request authorization code.This field applies only to OAuth.

clientID.description: The unique public identifier that the OAuth server generates for Integration Server during registration.This field applies only to OAuth.

clientSecret.description: The unique string that the OAuth server provides to Integration Server during registration.This field applies only to OAuth.

scope.description: The e-mail server access permissions configured for Integration Server during registration. You can specify multiple scopes separated by a space.This field applies only to OAuth.

accessTokenURL.description: The URL of the endpoint that Integration Server must use to request an access token from the OAuth server.This field applies only to OAuth.

redirectURL.description: The URL that the OAuth server must use to send authentication responses to Integration Server.This field applies only to OAuth.

tlsSettings.description: The type of SSL encryption that Integration Server uses when communicating with an email server. You can configure the port to use None , Explicit, or Implicit.

logout.description: For use with IMAP and multi-threading only. Whether you want your server to log out after checking for mail.

runAsUser.description: The user name under which requested services are to run.

authenticateWithMessage.description: When set to true, Integration Server checks for $user and $pass parameters in the Subject line of the email. The user name is the user under which the service is to run on Integration Server. When set to false, specify the user in the runAsUser field.

useJSSE.description: Whether the port will be created using the Java Secure Socket Extension.

globalService.description: The service that you want Integration Server to execute for every email request.

defaultService.description: The service that you want Integration Server to execute if the email message does not supply a valid service in the subject line and the globalService field is blank.

reply.description: Whether you want Integration Server to send any output that the service generates to the original sender in an email attachment.

replyOnError.description: Whether you want Integration Server to report errors to the original sender in the body portion of an email.

remove.description: Whether you want Integration Server to delete a valid email from the IMAP server once Integration Server has successfully received the email.

deleteInvalid.description: Whether you want Integration Server to delete invalid emails from the IMAP server.

multiThreaded.description: Whether you want Integration Server to use multiple threads for this port.

numThreads.description: The number of threads you want Integration Server to use for this port. This field is applicable only if multiThreaded is true.

invokePerPart.description: Whether Integration Server invokes the service for each part of a multipart message or just once for the entire message.

includeHeaders.description: Whether Integration Server includes the email headers when passing an email message to the content handler.

urlEncodedBody.description: Whether the email body contains URL-encoded input parameters to be decoded into IData, placed in the pipeline, and passed to the service.
